head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Germany: Anger Over U.S. Lawmaker's Remark On Schröder

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Germany: Anger Over U.S. Lawmaker's Remark On Schröder

abstract.p: German officials heatedly protest remarks made by Rep Tom Lantos, chairman of House Foreign Affairs Committee, in which he described former Chancellor Gerhard Schroder as 'political prostitute' for taking job with Russian state gas company (S)

block.p: German officials heatedly protested remarks made by Representative Tom Lantos, a Democrat of California who is chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, in which he described former Chancellor Gerhard Schröder as a ''political prostitute'' for taking a job with a Russian state gas company. The government spokesman, Ulrich Wilhelm, said the comment, made in a speech at the dedication ceremony for a victims of Communism memorial in Washington on Tuesday, was ''unseemly.'' The foreign minister, Frank-Walter Steinmeier, said it had breached the bounds of decorum and was a ''discredit'' to Mr. Lantos. Mr. Schröder has been criticized within Germany for his new job, overseeing a pipeline project.
